sentences.english: The old saying goes, ‘Dig your well before you’re thirsty.’
sentences.chinese: 像諺語說的，“在口渴之前挖井”。

sentences.english: As the proverb says , idle young, needy old.
sentences.chinese: 正如諺語所說，“少壯不努力，老大徒傷悲。”

sentences.english: “You can't get fat from eating a single mouthful” goes a saying in China.
sentences.chinese: “一口喫不成胖子”，中國的諺語說。

sentences.english: The texts on these objects tend to be either proverbs or general blessings.
sentences.chinese: 這些藝術品上的文字多爲諺語或一般的祝詞。

sentences.english: As the adage goes if you don't laugh you will cry.
sentences.chinese: 正如諺語所說，如果你不笑那便會哭泣。

sentences.english: As the old Chinese proverb says, "A journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step."
sentences.chinese: 像中國的古老諺語所說的，“千里之行始於足下。”

sentences.english: As its sententious style indicates, it was probably taken from a collection of wise sayings.
sentences.chinese: 其簡潔的風格表明，它可能是從收集了明智的諺語。

sentences.english: A proverb goes, "Better to lose with a wise man than win with a fool."
sentences.chinese: 有一句依地語諺語說得好，“寧輸智者，不贏傻子。”

sentences.english: " For a long time, "Huguang cooked, the world is adequate, " saying more widely circulated.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，“湖廣熟，天下足”諺語，更是廣爲流傳。

sentences.english: Don't judge a book by its ver.
sentences.chinese: 諺語，直譯“不要根據書皮來判斷書的內容”。

sentences.english: Do you know the proverb about money?
sentences.chinese: 你知道這個有關“錢”的諺語嗎？

sentences.english: Proverbs are short sentences drawn from long experience.
sentences.chinese: 諺語言短簡，得自老經驗。

sentences.english: Another proverb about love is: "Absence makes the heart grow fonder."
sentences.chinese: “小別勝新婚”是另一條有關愛的諺語。

sentences.english: As the saying goes, people like to work with people they like.
sentences.chinese: 正如諺語所說，人們樂意與他們喜歡的人一起工作。

sentences.english: As the saying goes, “never too old to learn.”
sentences.chinese: 正如諺語所說“活到老學到老“。

definition: vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
Three Character Classic, 13th century reading primer consisting of Confucian tenets in lines of 3 characters
meaning (implicit in a phrase)/implied meaning/hidden meaning/hint/connotation
established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
